topPRs.title: feat(plugin-knowledge): add configurable rate limits for high-through…
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Add RATE_LIMIT_ENABLED option to completely disable rate limiting
- Add configurable settings: MAX_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS, REQUESTS_PER_MINUTE, 
  TOKENS_PER_MINUTE, BATCH_DELAY_MS
- Increase default limits 5x for high-throughput APIs (Vercel gateway):
  - MAX_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS: 30 → 150
  - REQUESTS_PER_MINUTE: 60 → 300  
  - TOKENS_PER_MINUTE: 150k → 750k
  - BATCH_DELAY_MS: 500ms → 100ms
- Remove provider-specific rate caps to respect user configuration
- Fix TypeScript type errors in service.ts and document-processor.ts

Set RATE_LIMIT_ENABLED=false and BATCH_DELAY_MS=0 for maximum throughput
with APIs that don't have rate limits.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Enables high-throughput and configurable ingestion with explicit rate control and an option to disable limits entirely.
> 
> - Adds `RATE_LIMIT_ENABLED`, `MAX_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS`, `REQUESTS_PER_MINUTE`, `TOKENS_PER_MINUTE`, `BATCH_DELAY_MS` to `config/types`; increases defaults and wires through `getProviderRateLimits`, `document-processor`, and batching logic
> - Removes provider-specific rate caps; honors user-configured values and supports "unlimited" mode (no RPM/TPM caps, optional 0ms batch delay)
> - Improves setting parsing (e.g., `CTX_KNOWLEDGE_ENABLED`, `KNOWLEDGE_PATH`) and fixes TypeScript types/usages in `service.ts` and `document-processor.ts`
> - Minor behavior tweak: combines system+prompt when caching via `runtime.useModel`
> - Bumps package version and updates deps (notably `@elizaos/core` → `^1.7.0`)
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit fdceddb319242e2d5e1cb954c656daf85fbe0724. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Rate limiting is now configurable, including enable/disable toggle, maximum concurrent requests, per-minute request limits, and token rate limits.
  * Added batch processing delay configuration for request timing control.

* **Chores**
  * Upgraded @elizaos/core dependency to version 1.7.0.

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
